intro: Thymelaea tarton-raira subvar. valentina, commonly known as the pink thymelaea, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rutaceae family. It is characterized by its small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters, typically in late spring to early summer. The plant has a compact, shrub-like growth habit with small, leathery leaves that are usually covered in a fine, powdery coating. Native to southern Africa, it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun exposure. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its attractive flowers and drought tolerance.
